chunks.text: Welcome back. In this section we're going to look at numpy.

chunks.text: Now I'm very excited about this section because numpy is basically the backbone of all data

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: science machine learning and numerical computing and Python.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And that's actually what numpy stands for.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: The stands for numerical python.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And what is numpy?

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Well, in all of machine learning, no matter what kind of data that you're working with,

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: now this could be a data frame like we saw in the previous section on pandas.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Numpy is going to form the foundation of turning your data into a series of numbers.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And then what a machine learning algorithm will do is work out the patterns in those numbers.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: So if we refer back to our machine learning modeling framework, we've got step one as problem

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: definition, step two is data evaluation features modeling and experiments.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And if we have a look at what tools we can use in this section, we're going to be focused

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: on numpy numpy comes into the data analysis section.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: However, as you'll see in the future and what we just referenced before is that machine

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: learning, although it's referred to as modeling, is essentially taking data, turning it into

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: numbers.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And in this case with numpy, usually the form of a numpy array, which we'll have plenty

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: of experience with after this section.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And then finding patterns in those numbers.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: So almost across this entire pipeline, numpy will come into play.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Now, why numpy?

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Well, the main reason we use numpy instead of pure python.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: I mean, you can do numerical calculations in python.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: But usually if we want to do large scale numerical calculations, we refer to numpy.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: It's because it's fast.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And now the reason why it's fast is because behind the scenes, there's optimizations written

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: in C code.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: The beautiful thing about the numpy package is that you can use these C code optimizations

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: using pure python.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: That means you don't have to know C to be able to use numpy.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And python is a bit easier to write than pure C. So that's the advantage of using numpy.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Now it gets these optimizations in speed through a process called vectorization via a term

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: numpy uses called broadcasting, which is essentially just avoiding writing loops when you're

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: writing calculations.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Because if you're writing loops to make calculations such as in python to calculate over a list, that

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: can form some eventual slowdowns if you have a list say of millions of different numbers,

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: which becomes common practice when we're working on machine learning projects.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: And as we mentioned before, numpy is the backbone of other python scientific packages.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
chunks.text: Numpy actually forms the basis of the pandas package.

chunks.title: NumPy Introduction.mp3
